docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 -- Luis F. Gay, who was secretary of the Argentine Federation of Labor when a United States labor delegation visited Argentina last month, has disappeared, according to John Herling, who accompanied the delegation. Mr. Herling is...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 -- Luis F. Gay, who was secretary of the Argentine Federation of Labor when a United States labor delegation visited Argentina last month, has disappeared, according to John Herling, who accompanied the delegation. Mr. Herling is a free-lance newspaper correspondent and formerly was associated with the Office of the Coordinator of InterAmerican Affairs.
docs.abstract: Account on Jan disappearance of Argentine labor leader L F Gay discussed

headline.main: ARGENTINE LEADER OF LABOR VANISHES; U.S. Writer Says Luis Cay Was Ousted From Two Jobs After Inviting U.S. Colleagues

docs.snippet: ON an eight-francs red-brown stamp in an airmail series issued by French West Africa is philately's first portrait of Antoine de Saint-Exupery (1900-1944), French aviator and the author of "Night Flight," "Wind, Sand and Stars," "Flight to Arras,"...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON an eight-francs red-brown stamp in an airmail series issued by French West Africa is philately's first portrait of Antoine de Saint-Exupery (1900-1944), French aviator and the author of "Night Flight," "Wind, Sand and Stars," "Flight to Arras," and other books which attracted attention in America.

docs.snippet: Week Ended March 1, 1947 There was an undertone of softness in the Canadian free dollar and British pound in last week's foreign exchange market. These two currencies, which have been furnishing all of the activity of recent months, suffered...
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended March 1, 1947 There was an undertone of softness in the Canadian free dollar and British pound in last week's foreign exchange market. These two currencies, which have been furnishing all of the activity of recent months, suffered principally from a drying up of buyers interest, so that at the week's close losses were not particularly large.

docs.snippet: LONDON, March 4--With business easing and a tendency to take profits becoming apparent, one or two sections in the stock markets here today were less buoyant.

docs.snippet: The United States Government has paid at least $25,000,000 more for oil products in the Near East than was necessary, James A. Moffett, a retired executive of oil companies and former Federal Housing Administrator, charged yesterday in a statement.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Government has paid at least $25,000,000 more for oil products in the Near East than was necessary, James A. Moffett, a retired executive of oil companies and former Federal Housing Administrator, charged yesterday in a statement.
docs.abstract: J A Moffett charges US lost at least $25 million in connection with Arabian-Amer war deals by failing to accept '41 offer; involves Calif Standard Oil and Tex Cos; sees significance in present indus key posts of former Army and Navy officers; demands Sen inquiry

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., March 7--Secretary General Trygve Lie estimated today that the United Nations would be ready to move into its first $20,000,000 office building along the East River and vacate its headquarters here by Nov. 15, 1948.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., March 7--Secretary General Trygve Lie estimated today that the United Nations would be ready to move into its first $20,000,000 office building along the East River and vacate its headquarters here by Nov. 15, 1948.
docs.abstract: Sec Gen Lie estimates big office bldg will be ready for occupancy by Nov, '48; statement made pub after closed meeting of UN Hdqrs Advisory Com; com appts 5 more architects, 1 each from Australia, Belgium, Canada, Sweden and Uruguay, completing 10-man architectural bd

headline.main: U.N. PLANS TO MOVE IN NOVEMBER, 1948; Lie Expects Big Office Building Will Be Ready by Then-- Names 5 More Architects
